alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 1:34AM CST until January 29 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Sucarnoochee River At Livingston affecting Sumter County. .Heavy rainfall has occurred over the Sucarnoochee River basin and a flood warning is now in effect for the Sucarnoochee River. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 445 PM CST. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sucarnoochee River at Livingston. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flooding of farm lands around Livingston occurs. At 21.0 feet, Overflow of low-lying agricultural lands increases. Cattle and farm equipment should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday afternoon to a crest of 19.8 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
